title: CEDOCS Score for Emergency Department Overcrowding
description: Community Emergency Department Overcrowding Scale (CEDOCS) estimates the severity of overcrowding in community emergency departments. Provides objective quantification for resource allocation, patient flow management, and real-time assessment of ED crowding levels across varying patient volumes.

parameters.name: critical_care_patients
parameters.description: Number of patients currently requiring critical care in the ED

parameters.name: longest_wait_time_minutes
parameters.description: Waiting time of the longest admitted patient currently in the ED

parameters.name: waiting_room_patients
parameters.description: Number of patients currently in the waiting room

parameters.name: total_ed_patients
parameters.description: Total number of patients currently in the ED (including those being treated)

parameters.name: ed_beds
parameters.description: Total number of licensed beds in the emergency department

parameters.name: annual_ed_visits
parameters.description: Annual volume of ED visits (total visits per year for the department)

parameters.name: scaling_factor
parameters.description: Optional scaling factor for final score adjustment (default is 2.0)

result.name: cedocs_assessment
result.description: CEDOCS Score with overcrowding level assessment and clinical recommendations

ranges.interpretation: Normal ED operations. Minimal crowding with adequate resources and patient flow.
Increased activity but manageable. Monitor patient flow and resource allocation.
High activity level approaching capacity. Consider proactive measures to prevent overcrowding.
Overcrowding threshold exceeded. Implement overcrowding protocols and resource reallocation.
Severe overcrowding requiring immediate intervention. Consider diversion protocols and emergency staffing.
Critical overcrowding situation. Implement emergency measures, consider ambulance diversion.

references: Weiss SJ, Rogers DB, Maas F, Ernst AA, Nick TG. Evaluating community ED crowding: the Community ED Overcrowding Scale study. Am J Emerg Med. 2014 Nov;32(11):1357-63. doi: 10.1016/j.ajem.2014.08.035.

Weiss SJ, Ernst AA, Derlet R, King R, Bair A, Nick TG. Relationship between the National ED Overcrowding Scale and the number of patients who leave without being seen in an academic ED. Am J Emerg Med. 2005 Jul;23(4):456-61.
formula: CEDOCS = -29.53 + (3.14 × critical care patients) + (0.52 × longest wait) + (1.14 × waiting room patients) + (20.55 × total patients/ED beds) + (0.00124 × annual visits) + conditional adjustments (A+B+C+D) × scaling factor
notes: Developed specifically for community emergency departments with varying patient volumes
More broadly applicable than NEDOCS which was designed for academic centers
Overcrowding threshold defined as CEDOCS score > 100
Validated across EDs with annual volumes ≥ 18,000 patients per year
Uses complex cubic spline adjustments for different annual visit volume ranges
Default scaling factor is 2.0 if not specified
Score can exceed 200 in extreme overcrowding situations
Real-time calculation enables immediate decision-making for resource allocation
Helps standardize overcrowding assessment across different ED settings
Useful for quality improvement initiatives and research studies
Should be interpreted alongside clinical judgment and local protocols
Conditional adjustments (A, B, C, D) apply to specific annual visit thresholds
Patient-to-bed ratio is a key driver of the overcrowding score
Waiting time component reflects admitted patient boarding issues
